definition: to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)

sentences.english: Even so, the peace activists of the day reacted to the news of his Nobel Prize with mortification.
sentences.chinese: 当时的和平活动家们也对他成为诺奖得主感到耻辱。

sentences.english: He is among the recipients of the 2002 AAAS Newcomb Cleveland Prize.
sentences.chinese: 他是2002年美国科学促进协会的克里夫兰奖得主。

sentences.english: This year, an American researcher was the winner of the Tyler Prize for Environmental Achievement.
sentences.chinese: 今年，美国研究人员是在泰勒环境成就奖得主。

sentences.english: In addition, Mr. Zoellick has received numerous distinguished service awards.
sentences.chinese: 此外，佐利克先生还是若干杰出服务奖得主。

sentences.english: It is performed by Zhang Yechuan, who has won the highest award of drama in China "Meihua(plum flower) Award".
sentences.chinese: 饰演南越王赵佗的则是张页川是中国戏剧梅花奖得主。

sentences.english: Prize-winners and finalists will be offered contracts for engagements with national and international music organizations.
sentences.chinese: 奖得主和决赛将提供合同约定与国家和国际音乐组织。

sentences.english: He has also retold Gulliver's Travels, winner of the Kate Greenaway Medal with Don Quixote.
sentences.chinese: 他还新编格列佛游记，在格林威奖得主与堂吉诃德。

sentences.english: Because the age at which Nobel-winning work gets done has been going up.
sentences.chinese: 因为诺奖得主的年龄也越来越大了。

sentences.english: The two lottery winners decided to split the money fifty-fifty.
sentences.chinese: 两位彩票奖得主决定平分奖金。

sentences.english: He was named a Portfolio Gold Award winner.
sentences.chinese: 他被任命为一个组合金奖得主。

definition: Nobel Prize/abbr. for 諾貝爾獎|诺贝尔奖[Nuo4 bei4 er3 Jiang3]
the Wolf prize (for science and arts)

pinyin: Nuo4 bei4 er3 Wen2 xue2 Jiang3
